means: 任命（某人）为牧师( ordain的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Destiny has ordained that they are who they are.
sentence.Network_cn: 命运已经决定了他们的性格为人。

sentence.Network_en: He ordained his own priests, and threatened to ordain bishops.
sentence.Network_cn: 他自行任命了牧师，还扬言要任命主教。

sentence.Network_en: America's belief in its own God-ordained uniqueness started to erode.
sentence.Network_cn: 美国人心中上帝赋予了他们独一无二的品质的信念开始逐渐丧失。

PerfectNetExp.abs: the body of ordained religious practitioners ., 被任命的宗教的从业者.
Then he was ordained a monk and gave up his kingly life ., 然后他被任命为和尚 , 放弃了他的君主生活.
Pastoral staff are called or ordained according to the Constitution ., 52 教牧同工由教会按章程聘请或按立.
The first is technological change beyond that ordained by Moore ' s Law ., 首先是技术变革超出摩尔定律的藩篱.

list.abs: optometrist 验光师ordained minister 经过圣命的牧师order 顺序;命令
晋秩职务(ordained ministry)，或称「公务司祭职」， 是为圣洗的司祭职服务。公务司祭职保证在圣事中，是基督亲自藉着圣神，为教 …
...帝的子民被呼召去做的服事。另一种是受按职事 (Ordained Ministry)，就是获得恩赐，并获教会藉圣灵及按手礼授职，以带领整个整 …
He was ordained bishop and assumed the cathedra of the Diocese of Taichung in 1986 ., 他在 1986年获任命为主教出任台中教区的主教宝座.
fate ordained that they should meet .命运注定了他们要相遇。

entry.tran: 授予…圣职;任命…为神职人员
entry.def: When someone is ordained, they are made a member of the clergy in a religious ceremony.

example.ex: He was ordained a Catholic priest in 1982...
example.tran: 他于1982年被任命为天主教司铎。

example.ex: Women have been ordained for many years in the Church of Scotland...
example.tran: 苏格兰长老会多年前就已开始任命女性担任圣职。

entry.def: If some authority or power ordains something, they decide that it should happen or be in existence.

example.ex: Destiny has ordained that they are who they are...
example.tran: 命运已经决定了他们的性格为人。

example.ex: His rule was ordained by heaven...

means.word_mean: 1. fixed or established especially by order or command;

sentences.sentence: "at the time appointed (or the appointed time")

means.word_mean: 2. invested with ministerial or priestly functions;

auth_sentence.content: The opposition complained bitterly that the results were fore-ordained.
auth_sentence.res_content: The opposition complained bitterly that the results were fore-ordained.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The opposition complained bitterly that the results were fore-ordained.

auth_sentence.content: I think this thing is ordained it's providence.
auth_sentence.res_content: I think this thing is ordained it's providence.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I think this thing is ordained it's providence.

auth_sentence.content: A middle-aged man who had been ordained late in life.
